result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy L Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:45am
INCLUDES 15CM2226 & 15CM2230
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Deft appears with Atty Zach Glascock.
  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CM2230:
Ct. 1 Battery- domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct- domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Resisting or obstructing an officer >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
15CM2226:
Ct. 1 Criminal Damage to Property >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 12 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1 and AMEND Ct. 2 to county disorderly conduct and pay $5.00 forfeiture. 

DEOJ RH>> 03/01/2017 at 1:10pm in DA's office

Atty Glascock addresses bond conditions and have no contact with A.B. be lifted
State does not have stance on bond condition
COURT modify bond in 15CM2226 to lift no contact with son A.B.
Bond continues.

Adj: 10:01am

Pre-trial conference at 01-05-2016 08:40 am.
Final pre-trial at 02-03-2016 08:40 am.
Jury Trial at 02-29-2016 08:30 am.

Includes 15CM2226 and 15CM2230.    No contact with victim(s):  J.G. and A.B.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents
